alert.note: Alert for Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:56PM EDT until June 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL LEBANON COUNTY... At 455 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Annville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Palmyra, Annville, Cornwall, Myerstown, Campbelltown, Pleasant Hill, Sand Hill, Lebanon South, Cleona, Avon and Fredericksburg. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 260 to 264. Interstate 78 from mile markers 0 to 5. Interstate 81 from mile markers 86 to 90. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
